trans-unit.source: Provides a context-enabled binding for the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSHttpContextBinding"></xref>

The <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpContextBinding> adds a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ContextBindingElement> to the stack of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BindingElement> objects in the system-provided <xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding>.
This enables SOAP headers to be used to exchange context when HTTP cookies are not enabled.

When calling a [!INCLUDE[indigo2](~/includes/indigo2-md.md)] service built with [!INCLUDE[netfx40_long](~/includes/netfx40-long-md.md)] from a WCF client application built with [!INCLUDE[netfx35_long](~/includes/netfx35-long-md.md)] or earlier, the configuration file generated by svcutil.exe or adding a service reference from [!INCLUDE[vsprvs](~/includes/vsprvs-md.md)] contains the `contextManagementEnabled` attribute in the binding configuration.

This attribute is not recognized by the [!INCLUDE[netfx35_short](~/includes/netfx35-short-md.md)] runtime and the application throws a <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationErrorsException> with the message "Unrecognized attribute 'contextManagementEnabled".
To workaround this problem, remove the `contextManagementEnabled` attribute from the binding configuration.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSHttpContextBinding"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSHttpContextBinding"></xref> class using the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode"></xref>.
Use this constructor when you want to configure security but not enable reliable sessions.
The security mode.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSHttpContextBinding"></xref> class with the specified binding configuration.
The `configName` parameter should be set to the name of the `<binding>` element in the configuration file that configures this binding.
The name of the binding configuration.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSHttpContextBinding"></xref> class with the specified <xref href="System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode"></xref> and reliable session setting.
Use this constructor when you want to configure the security and enable reliable sessions.
The security mode.
`true` to enable reliable sessions; otherwise `false`.
Gets or sets the client callback address.
The client callback address.
Gets a value that specifies whether context management is enabled.
`true` if context management is enabled; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the context protection level for this binding.
The protection level for the binding.
Creates an ordered collection of binding elements that are contained in the current binding.

The collection contains the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.ContextBindingElement>, which enables SOAP headers to be used to exchange context when HTTP cookies are not enabled; otherwise use HTTP cookies to exchange context.
The ordered stack of binding elements described by the <xref href="System.ServiceModel.WSHttpContextBinding"></xref>.
